column4: Q: I was trying to find a irc client and found XChat, downloaded it from the official website has a RPM but I couldnt install in ubuntu. I find a tip on how to insall it trough command line, worked just fine. My question is (has a linux newbie), what type of files are compatible with ubuntu ? Thanks
thanks for the .deb tip. so, .deb is a executable ? I'm seeing that is easier to do stuff trough the terminal :X
I'm trying to stick with linux only apps, otherwise I would stick with win7 :X
